text: The GPU side is an issue as well as sometimes its difficult to figure out why some bit of added code doesn't work (ex. calls into the julia runtime due to an inference  / inlining issue).  Since there is not really a spec for what bits of julia can and can't be compiled with the GPU (and this is context specific), this sometimes leads to sharp edges and long debug sessions for easy errors for scientists.  I think that will be gradually addressed as the tooling matures as well.  Probably Clima is the largest project using the GPU stack (speculative) so this is probably more because of the scale of the project that all the current sharp edges are hit.
